Stories like Kerry's have been pouring into the inboxes of my colleagues from across the country.
Kerry's cancer has now been in remission since Sept. 2015. "The ACA came along at the last possible moment to save my life," Kerry said.
Kerry had surgery a week later, followed by 6 months of chemo, & faced no out of pocket expenses besides her deductible.
Fast forward to Jan 2015: a routine procedure covered by her new insurance under the #ACA revealed Kerry had stage 3 colon cancer.
She had some nagging pain in her lower back, but didn't think much of it, considering she had no family history of disease.
Kerry signed up for health insurance in 2014 thanks to a subsidy provided through the #ACA.
I want to share Kerry's story. A massage therapist & yoga instructor from Wilmington, she considers the #ACA "nothi… https://t.co/jSltV05qwV
